column1: Data Supplied By: National Livestock Reporting Service
Data source: National Livestock Reporting Service
Please see terms of use here: https://www.mla.com.au/general/Terms-and-conditions/data-and-information/

Numbers decreased by 443 for a yarding of 2261 cattle. It was a mixed quality yarding consisting of some isolated good pens of heavy cows and bullocks, some very good individual animals, along with plainer conditioned lines. All regulars processors were in attendance and operating, supported by one feeder, one live exporter and opportunity backgrounders. Cattle were drawn from Richmond, Croydon, Mt Surprise, Torrens Creek, Pentland, local and coastal areas.

Buyer demand was strong for the majority penned, particularly good quality store steers and heifers, however heavy bulls met notably less demand. Grown steers and heifers lifted up to 15c, heavy bullocks increased 9c, heavy cows improved by. 5c and bulls averaged 30c to 60c lower.

Suitably weaned steers returning to the paddock sold to 282c to average 259c, similarly heifers averaged 246c/kg. A large sample of steers above 200kg to backgrounders made to 360c to average 314c/kg. Good quality flatback heifers made to 278c to average 253c to 263c/kg. Yearling steers above above 330kg to restockers sold to 326c to average 304c to 308c and those suitable for live export sold to 294c/kg. Yearling heifers above 200kg to the trade sold to 248c, averaging 242c and heifers above 330kg to feed averaged 275c/kg. Good quality yearling heifers above 400kg to the trade sold to 290c/kg.  A small number of Grown steers to the trade sold to 318c to average 309c, grown heifers to the trade reached 264c to average 245c/kg. 

Heavy young bullocks to export slaughter topped at 345c to average 326c/kg. Medium weight 3 score cows to processors sold to 280c to average 251c, prime heavyweight cows 4 score cows topped at 288c to average 283c/kg. Heavy bulls to live export sold to 284c, processor bulls reached 276c to average 240c/kg.

A small number of cows and calves sold to $935 per unit.

Market Reporter, Mick Kingham
